paper_abstract: The simultaneous contributions of proton and electron transfer to the Bronsted-Lowry and Lewis acid-base properties of a set of p-substituted phenols are reported in this work. As a result of the analysis, a novel protophilicity index considered as the second-order energy change of a Bronsted-Lowry base as it is saturated with protons, a combined Bronsted-Lowry-Lewis acidity index (with a corresponding basicity index), and a protofelicity equalization principle (a parallel of the electronegativity equalization principle) are presented.
paper_title: Protophilicity index and protofelicity equalization principle: new measures of Bronsted-Lowry-Lewis acid-base interactions
